intro: Notogramme, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is native to various regions of Africa and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically have narrow, linear leaves and produce yellow or orange composite flowers. Notogramme species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant colors and drought tolerance. They are also valued for their ability to thrive in poor soils and their role in supporting pollinators.
